cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterflies are described as having a life cycle that includes multiple stages.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: LifeCycleType: complete metamorphosis implied by stages

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterflies have an adult butterfly stage in their life cycle.
The observed butterfly is associated with a moment characterized by beauty and grace.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: when you see a butterfly fluttering by
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: ObserverContext: human observer taking a moment to marvel

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links an organism or group of organisms to the overall life cycle structure that characterizes them.
args.justification: This relation connects butterflies to their characteristic life cycle as a whole, so a predicate emphasizing that the organism has a particular life cycle is appropriate.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links an organism or group of organisms to a specific developmental or life stage within its life cycle.
args.justification: This relation connects butterflies to a specific stage (adult butterfly stage) within their life cycle, so a predicate focused on membership of that stage is appropriate.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links an entity to a subjective or experiential state (such as a moment of beauty or grace) that observers commonly associate with it.
args.justification: The relation describes butterflies being associated with a human-perceived moment of beauty and grace, which is best modeled as association with an experiential state rather than a biological or structural relation.
Both relations connect butterflies to aspects of their life cycle (overall cycle, specific life stage), so they belong in the same broader class of organism life cycle relations.
Life cycles and life stages are inherently temporal constructs that describe how an organism changes over time, so these relations fall under a temporality-focused group.
This relation encodes how butterflies are tied to human perception and appreciation (aesthetic experience), distinct from biological or ecological relations.
The link is a loose, conceptual association between butterflies and a subjective moment of beauty and grace, fitting an association-oriented group rather than causal or compositional ones.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Links an organism or group of organisms to the overall life cycle structure that characterizes them.
executed_decisions.justification: This relation connects butterflies to their characteristic life cycle as a whole, so a predicate emphasizing that the organism has a particular life cycle is appropriate.
